question: This question is just about unit analysis, so don't worry that some of the quantities we are using are unfamiliar.You will encounter pressure in other courses, especially if you are in certain of the technology programs where you will take some fluids courses.  Here is one equation which gives a pressure (this is pressure within a stationary fluid)\(\Delta P = ho g h \)where ΔP is a pressure change, ρ is a density (in kg/m3), g is an acceleration and h is a height (distance).  From this, determine the correct units of pressure in terms of base SI units.
